channel.title: [PI] Flax Picking 100%
channel.description:
Can anyone give me a lead to a Runescape-Like-Flax Picking?
Flax is removed Flax respawns same location.
Been trying to convert this froma woodcutting class, but I keep getting countless errors, so I gave up. And removed it. YESTERDAY

item.title: [PI] Flax Picking 100%
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Host Gushers, post:9, topic:524880”][quote author=Driman Rune link=topic=643574.msg4331884#msg4331884 date=1373759068]
… It was a joke, this is 5000x better than that, made it in like 30 minutes.

package server.model.objects.ClickObject.GlobalObjects;

import server.model.players.;
import server.event.;
import server.model.items.;
import server.world.;
import server.*;

public class PickableObjects {

public static void pickupFlax(final Client c, final int object, final int obX, final int obY) {

                    c.startAnimation(827);

                    EventManager.getSingleton().addEvent(new Event() {
                            public void execute(EventContainer container) {        
                                    Server.objectHandler.createAnObject(c, -1, obX, obY);
                                    c.getItems().addItem(1779, 1);
                                    container.stop();
                            }
                            public void stop() {

                            }
                    }, 750);
                    EventManager.getSingleton().addEvent(new Event() {
                            public void execute(EventContainer container) {
                                    Server.objectHandler.createAnObject(c, object, obX, obY);
                                    container.stop();
                            }
                            public void stop() {

                            }
                    }, 13000);
            }

uses events
respawns
removes
no bugs

[/quote]
i bet u didn’t make that code. Probably took it from your base and copy and pasted it.[/quote]
Wouldn’t surprise me…

http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-server/tutorials/367623-delta-pi-pickables-event.html

This has just about every pickable you’d want…

Read full topic

uses events

removes

item.title: [PI] Flax Picking 100%
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

I don’t know why he made this thread if he could do it himself. You don’t need good quality code if you’re using PI anyway (no offense to PI but it’s kinda… :L).

I don’t know why you made a new class. If you want flax to disappear after x amount of times just use Misc.random or something simple because you clearly have no idea what you are doing.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Flax Picking 100%
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

why cast the flax object into the params, if it will only always create flax again.
also, why close the event, inside the event’s execution?

item.title: [PI] Flax Picking 100%
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

[quote=“Driman Rune, post:3, topic:524880”]Get that ugly code away from here.[/quote]he gave you a very decent push into the right direction

however, flax isn’t always removed after picking. not sure how many you can get but i’d say 1-15(?)

also, id recommend using a task/event depending on the design of your server

item.title: [PI] Flax Picking 100%
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

[code=java]if (System.currentTimeMillis() - c.delay > 1500) {
c.turnPlayerTo(c.objectX, c.objectY);
c.startAnimation(2292);
c.getPA().object(-1, 2739, 3444, 0, 10);

c.getItems().addItem(1779,1);
c.sendMessage("You pick some flax.");
c.delay = System.currentTimeMillis();

}[/code]
